p: Effective coordination across local and national government in the UK is vital for biological security [ 5]. The nature of threats to biological security necessitates a focus beyond the national level in policy and governance, and coordination with many other national, regional and international organisations [ 43]. One of the main forums in which the UK is consistently engaged is the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production and Stockpiling of Bacteriological (Biological) and Toxin Weapons and on Their Destruction (BTWC) and the related Meetings of Experts, States Parties and Review Conferences which it has made numerous submissions to [ 44].
